conclusion: Determine the time t for light to travel from point O to the boundary of the right-angled trapezoid ABDE.
The refractive index of the transparent body is sqrt(2).
The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 3 x 10^8 meters per second.
The speed of light in the body is sqrt(2) times the speed of light in a vacuum.
Distance AB is sqrt(2) times the distance DE.
DE is the shorter leg of the right-angled trapezoid.
Use the Pythagorean theorem to find the length of DE: DE = sqrt(AB^2 - AD^2).
AB is the hypotenuse of the right-angled triangle AOB.
OA = OB = 1 (since it's a right-angled trapezoid).
Substitute values into the equation: AB = sqrt(1^2 + 1^2) = sqrt(2).
Use the refractive index to find the time t: t = AB/v.
v is the speed of light in the body, which is sqrt(2) x 3 x 10^8 meters per second.
The time t it takes for light to travel from point O to the boundary of the right-angled trapezoid ABDE is 3sqrt(2)/2 seconds.
